name: Brief Self-Control Scale
description: A 13-item measure of dispositional self-control assessing the ability to override or change one's inner responses, as well as to interrupt undesired behavioral tendencies and refrain from acting on them.
reference: Tangney, J. P., Baumeister, R. F., & Boone, A. L. (2004). High self-control predicts good adjustment, less pathology, better grades, and interpersonal success. Journal of Personality, 72(2), 271-324.
instructions: Using the scale provided, please indicate how much each of the following statements reflects how you typically are.

questions.name: bscs_1
questions.description: I am good at resisting temptation.

questions.name: bscs_2
questions.description: I have a hard time breaking bad habits.

questions.name: bscs_5
questions.description: I do certain things that are bad for me, if they are fun.

questions.name: bscs_6
questions.description: I refuse things that are bad for me.

questions.name: bscs_7
questions.description: I wish I had more self-discipline.

questions.name: bscs_8
questions.description: People would say that I have iron self-discipline.

questions.name: bscs_9
questions.description: Pleasure and fun sometimes keep me from getting work done.

questions.name: bscs_11
questions.description: I am able to work effectively toward long-term goals.

questions.name: bscs_12
questions.description: Sometimes I can't stop myself from doing something, even if I know it is wrong.

questions.name: bscs_13
questions.description: I often act without thinking through all the alternatives.
